Package org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.staging

Generic staging framework and generic implementations of such used to execute batches in parallel.
See Also:
Stage, Step
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BatchSender
    Sends a batch downstream, typically when a batch is processed by ProcessorStep it can get sent downstream, if there is a downstream Step, for further processing.
    ExecutionMonitor
    Gets notified now and then about StageExecution, where statistics can be read and displayed, aggregated or in other ways make sense of the data of StageExecution.
    HumanUnderstandableExecutionMonitor.Monitor  
    Panicable  
    StageControl
    Represents a means to control and coordinate lifecycle matters about a Stage and all its steps.
    Step<T>
    One step in Stage, where a Stage is a sequence of steps.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractStep<T>
    Basic implementation of a Step.
    BatchFeedStep
    Releases batches of record ids to be read, potentially in parallel, by downstream batches.
    CoarseBoundedProgressExecutionMonitor
    An ExecutionMonitor that prints progress in percent, knowing the max number of nodes and relationships in advance.
    Downstream  
    DynamicProcessorAssigner
    Monitors executions and makes changes as the execution goes: Figures out roughly how many CPUs (henceforth called processors) are busy processing batches.
    ExecutionMonitor.Adapter
    Base implementation with most methods defaulting to not doing anything.
    ExecutionMonitors
    Common ExecutionMonitor implementations.
    ExecutionSupervisor
    Supervises a StageExecution until it is no longer executing.
    ExecutionSupervisors
    Convenience around executing and supervising stages.
    ForkedProcessorStep<T>
    Executes batches by multiple threads.
    HumanUnderstandableExecutionMonitor
    Prints progress you can actually understand, with capabilities to on demand print completely incomprehensible details only understandable to a select few.
    LonelyProcessingStep
    Step that doesn't receive batches, doesn't send batches downstream; just processes data.
    MovingAverage
    In a moving average calculation, only the last N values are considered.
    MultiExecutionMonitor
    ExecutionMonitor that wraps several other monitors.
    ProcessorStep<T>
    Step that uses TaskExecutor as a queue and execution mechanism.
    ProducerStep
    Step that generally sits first in a Stage and produces batches that will flow downstream to other steps.
    PullingProducerStep  
    QuantizedProjection
    Takes a value range and projects it to a very discrete number of integer values, quantizing based on float precision.
    ReadRecordsStep<RECORD extends AbstractBaseRecord>
    Reads records from a RecordStore and sends batches of those records downstream.
    RecordDataAssembler<RECORD extends AbstractBaseRecord>
    Convenience for reading and assembling records w/ potential filtering into an array.
    SendDownstream  
    SpectrumExecutionMonitor
    This is supposed to be a beautiful one-line ExecutionMonitor, looking like:
    Stage
    A stage of processing, mainly consisting of one or more steps that batches of data to process flows through.
    StageExecution
    Default implementation of StageControl
    TicketedBatch  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    HumanUnderstandableExecutionMonitor.ImportStage
